     6  package parlfs
     7  
     8  import (
     9  	"path/filepath"
    10  	"strings"
    11  )
    12  
    13  const (
    14  	sSep = string(filepath.Separator)
    15  )
    16  
    17  // Tree consists of one or more indexed roots, each root a subhierarchy of the file system
    18  type Tree struct {
    19  	List  []Root
    20  	Index map[string]int // key: evaled path, value: index in RootList
    21  }
    22  
    23  // NewTree allocates a Tree
    24  func NewTree() *Tree {
    25  	return &Tree{Index: map[string]int{}}
    26  }
    27  
    28  // AddRoot adds a new root
    29  func (tree *Tree) AddRoot(path string) (symlinkTargets []string, err error) {
    30  	root, err := NewRoot(path)
    31  	if err != nil {
    32  		return
    33  	}
    34  
    35  	// add new root node
    36  	listIndex := len(tree.List)
    37  	tree.Index[root.Evaled] = listIndex
    38  	tree.List = append(tree.List, *root)
    39  	root = &tree.List[listIndex]
    40  	symlinkAggregator := func(path string) {
    41  		symlinkTargets = append(symlinkTargets, path)
    42  	}
    43  	root.Build(symlinkAggregator)
    44  	return
    45  }
    46  
    47  // ResolveSymlink patches the tree for a symlink
    48  func (tree *Tree) ResolveSymlink(path string) (symlinkTargets []string, err error) {
    49  	var abs string
    50  	if abs, err = AbsEval(path); err != nil {
    51  		return
    52  	}
    53  	exists, roots := tree.checkPath(abs)
    54  	if exists {
    55  		return // known root or subdirectory of known root
    56  	}
    57  	// TODO this discards work, processed roots should be used in traversing superior root
    58  	for _, root := range roots {
    59  		index := tree.Index[root.Evaled]
    60  		delete(tree.Index, root.Evaled)
    61  		for key, ix := range tree.Index {
    62  			if ix < index {
    63  				continue
    64  			}
    65  			tree.Index[key] = ix - 1
    66  		}
    67  		tree.List = append(tree.List[0:index], tree.List[index+1:]...)
    68  	}
    69  	return tree.AddRoot(path)
    70  }
    71  
    72  func (tree *Tree) checkPath(abs string) (exists bool, roots []*Root) {
    73  	// is path an existing root or a subdirecty of an existing root?
    74  	if _, exists = tree.Index[abs]; exists {
    75  		return // abs is an existing root: exists true
    76  	}
    77  	for _, root2 := range tree.List {
    78  		if strings.HasPrefix(abs+sSep, root2.Evaled+sSep) {
    79  			exists = true
    80  			return // abs is a subdirectory of an existing root: exists true
    81  		}
    82  		if strings.HasPrefix(root2.Evaled+sSep, abs+sSep) {
    83  			roots = append(roots, &root2)
    84  		}
    85  	}
    86  	return // abs is separate from all known roots: exists false, roots: sub-roots
    87  }
    88  
    89  // Walk traverses the built tree
    90  func (tree *Tree) Walk(walkFunc filepath.WalkFunc) error {
    91  	for _, root := range tree.List {
    92  		if err := root.Walk(walkFunc); err != nil && err != filepath.SkipDir {
    93  			return err
    94  		}
    95  	}
    96  	return nil
    97  }
